Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close to the U- and S-bahn stations”
Reviews.Author: heavyrail
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the East Berlin, in walking distance to U-bahn (3 minutes walk) and S-bahn stations (10 minutes walk). It is integrated into the shopping center and has two entrance: the main entrance from the side street, opened 24h, and the second entrance from the courtyard of the shopping centre, which, in turn, is accessible from the main street and closed from 12am till 6am. Our room was pretty spacious, with two wide and comfortable single beds. There was an airconditioning system, old-styled TV, a table, an armchair and a chair. Wi-Fi was quite expensive (5 EUR / 0.5h, 15 EUR / day), so we didn't make use of it. There were no minibar or refrigerator, but there were several glasses in the room, and there were vending machines with pretty good selection of wines, beers, strong alcohol and snacks near the elevator on some of the floors. There were plenty of electric outlets in the room. Bathroom equipment was weared off a bit, but worked well. There was an hairdryer. All towels had been changed every day, even if we didn't drop it down. Buffet breakfast was very rich and taste. One major issue was one of waiter's behaviour. Once a morning he dropped off the napkin when serving tables. He quickly looked around, then putted the napkin up to the table, were thinking nobody saw him. Unfortunately we saw, and then reported the hotel in writing. We didn't see him anymore. Reception staff was always welcoming and friendly, and glad to help. So, this was a comfortable and quiet hotel, and we would like to recommend it to anyone who want to stay not far from the center of the city (5 stops by U-bahn to Alexanderplatz).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and simple hotel close to the U-Bahn.”
Reviews.Author: TorsteinKarlsen
Reviews.Content: The location is allright for a base in Berlin. Regardless of what you're gonna be doing, you're definitely gonna be using the S- and U-bahn alot. Hotel Arcadia is located in a plaza type of thing in a quiet neighorhood. If you want to party right outside your hotel, then this is not the one for you. It did however have a couple of great restauarants right next to it in the plaza. There's not alot of noises outside at night. I don't really see alot of the staff while I'm at a hotel, but they seemed nice enough. I arrived a few hours before the regular check-in time, but that was not a problem and I got a room right away. The cleaning ladies did a good job. Both the entry, lift and welcome area seems very nice and classy. The room however wasn't that nice looking. The walls are missing... anything really and it seems very white and sterile. It could be alot more cozy with some extra decorations. The bathroom was allright, good enough space and also a bathtub. Also a free to use hairdryer there. The bedroom had a small tv (probably 14" i think), too bad all the channels where german. Although it's funny to see movies dubbed, since after all it is a part of the german culture, it would still be nice with 1-2 english channels or atleast a music channel. They did have some Sky Pay-Per-View channels, I didn't use them so don't know the prices or how they where. There is no minibar or fridge, which is a negative. No in-room safe, but the reception got a free safe available. I was happy with my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: LKBMB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying a couple nights here to visit family who recently moved to Berlin and see a few sights. The hotel, at 77 euros per room per night, turned out to be a superb choice. The location is next to a busy street where you can get everything you need, is literally a two-minute walk to the U-bahn (subway), and yet is quiet and comfortable enough to grant a peaceful night's sleep. The room was impeccably clean, the way I have come to expect German hotels to be. We interacted with three different reception staff and they were all incredibly friendly. There is no room service but they have convenient vending machines with a good-enough variety of German goodies. Breakfast is an extra 14 euros, which seemed high to me, so we conveniently grabbed something on Frankfurter Allee on our way out. But it would be nicer for them to somewhat reduce the price of the breakfast for older people, like my in-laws, who wanted to enjoy a long breakfast in the hotel. Also, they charge for internet use, even in the lobby, which I always find ridiculous. Parking in the garage is 12 euros a day but there is enough on-street parking around the neighborhood that isn't even metered that I would recommend looking around before going straight to the garage. We parked our car about a 5 minute walk from the hotel and left it there the entire stay without problem.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin rocks!!! Hope we`ll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ViviJeff
Reviews.Content: Berlin is an amazing city, the longer you stay, the more you like. The history of the city, its rebuilding through the world wars to become this great, cosmopolitan town makes Berlin one of the most interesting places to visit in Europe. Try the walkin guided city tour.

Reviews.Title: “Olga at the Front Desk...”
Reviews.Author: mukkamukka
Reviews.Content: Was super nice, super helpful, and super cute. Hotel was a great value. Clean, quiet, cheap, and a quick trip to the city center. And the lights in the bathroom mirror make you feel like a model. If you need internet, there is a great place just up the street. 1 euro an hour (and sells beer cheap, too). The only thing to look out for is that the breakfast is a bit pricey at 14 euros/person.

Reviews.Title: “strategic position”
Reviews.Author: Beatrix81
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel, rooms were well furnished and clean but what I appreciated the most is the position of this hotel, close to Brandeburg tor and the Reichstag, and to Alexanderplatz (from where you can reach every part of the city). There is an internal square in the building to which the hotel belongs, it is not very crowded (this makes rooms very quiet) but you can find an ATM machine and an apotecary there. I would not recommend to have lunch or dinner in one of the 3 restaurants in the square because Berlin is full of places where you can eat and enjoy, but all of them have very good reviews on tourist guides.

Reviews.Title: “Experience East berlin”
Reviews.Author: ichibanwanderer
Reviews.Content: The hotel had been booked for us and i had no idea of the location but it proved to be ideal for the first time traveller to Berlin. Located near the U Bahn it was ideal for both the centre (Alexanderplatz) and the airport. Breakfast was excellent and staff all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: DougOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for one week and were quite satisfied. The location is great – not the City Center but very close by transit. The trip from the airport, using public transit was very fast (and inexpensive of course). There was some street noise but the hotel is in a real neighborhood and I would never trade windows that open for AC. There are restaurants and cafes in the area (but what area of Berlin does not have cafes) so we did not eat at the hotel – not that we likely would regardless of the hotel. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: agentgibbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for Samaritastrasse on the U5, one stop on from Frankfurter Tor. The name is a bit misleading. The address is also misleading as the front of the hotel is in Voigt Strasse and when we arrived we ended going in the back through the plaza. The rooms are clean. We use Premier Travel Inn a lot in the UK and the rooms at the Tulip Inn are slightly small in comparison, but the standard is about the same. The shower was very feeble. We spoke to other guests staying on another floor who said they had the same problem. If a power shower is high on your list of priorities this is not the place for you. We were on the 6th floor. There are two glass lifts overlooking the plaza and this was difficult for me at first because I do not like heights. This might be another consideration. We found the staff helpful. When the fridge in one of our rooms broke down it was replaced within ten minutes of reporting. We spoke to other guests who had not been so foruntate so it seems to depend on who is on duty at the time. There is a handy Netto near the station for bottled water etc, which is open quite long hours (0700-2200 except Sundays). We did not try the breakfast as at 14 euros per person it seemed expensive. We used "Cafe im Plaza" where a light breakfast cost us 15 euro for four people. The staff there were very friendly and let us practise our German. Worst thing apart from the shower was the piped music which fortunately was only turned on on the last day of our stay! Internet was expensive so we used the internet cafe at Dunkin Donuts near Alexander Platz- 2 euro an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BoozyinBolivia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst on yet another stag weekend abroad. Have to say the Tulip Inn is probably the best value for money hotel that I've stayed in. For 3 nights it cost me around 108 Euros (based on 3 of us sharing). Staff were very polite & efficient & check-in was done in no time at all. Triple room was spacious enough, very clean, & new towels each day. Very good air conditioning & huge windows too, very handy when it's very hot outside. Bathroom was spacious too with both a bath & an excellent shower. Breakfast was great too, hot / cold buffet & a good selection of cereals, pastries, bread rolls & fruit juices. Coffee was excellent too. Ideally everything you need to set you up for a day's trek around Berlin. Locationwise it's outwith the central (toursisty / shopping) area of Berlin, but there's a tube station 2 minutes walk from hotel (Frankfurter Tor) which is only 4 or 5 stops from Alexanderplatz, which we used on a daily basis. We also found Frankfurter Allee & the surrounding area pleasant & friendly enough, quite a few cafes / restaurants too if you don't want to wander too far. There's also an adjoining shopping precinct with some more cafes & restaurants (we ate at the Thai restaurant there late afternoon after we'd got checked in...delicious!). I have absolutely no hesitation in highly recommending the Tulip Inn Frankfurter Tor to anyone, from business trips to backpackers travelling on a budget of 35-40 Euros a night upwards.

Reviews.Title: “Über cool location”
Reviews.Author: Love_Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and most importantly - fantastic location! :) It's not in the city center, but you can get there with the underground railway in about 10 minutes. However, we were all 15 travellers really satisfied that we chose this location rather than a expensive hotel in the city centre. The hotel is quite cheap and is located in the eastern part of the city which has a incredible nice athmosphere. Lots of cosy small streets with trendy shops and nice resaurants/cafees. The Simon Dach strasse which lies a 5 minutes walk from the hotel is in my opinion a real top spot. Every evening and night the Simon Dach strasse is packed with people making a incredible nice athmosphere - go there! The average age in this area is 33 years which makes it a perfect destination for young people like me :) Apart from the location the hotel has quite nice comfort, cleanliness etc. We were 15 travelers without any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: suncambridge
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days in Berlin in this great hotel. It is very easy to find, less than 10 min away from the city center by underground (only one metro line and last stop in Alexandra plaza, cant be easier). The room was big, very quit. The people that works at the hotel were also very nice. We did not have breakfast there as it was cheaper to have it out, and there are lots of nice coffes around with really nice cakes , great bread and coffee. Overall, for the price of 36pounds a night, we think we could not get better! The back to the hotel leeds to a smal and friendly shooping center, but we never went there, just saw it from the elevater, but it seems quiet and nice. Berlin is amazing, so much to do, great cafes, great restaurant and great night shows! We arrived at the hotel everynight around midnight and we felt completly safe! . We went every night to city center, great time! Have anice time

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Joker_2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights over my summer holiday at Berlin. The way to reach hotel was so easy. It was comfortable to go to city and shopping center by undergrounds, trains, buses or by walk. Inside the hotel, room was pretty small and quite. Staffs were friendly, one of them (a guy) spoke English very well. Breakfast served you right at the balcony, looked simple to me--nothing amazing more than just bread and cheese, salami, coffee/tea/juices.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hengelo
Reviews.Content: Joke and Guus Dekking, Netherlands. We stayed her two nights, i.e. february 24 and 25, 2007. Good location, very close to the U5 subway station Samariterstrasse. Quiet at night, clean room. Friendly and helpfull staff. Situated around a huge inner courtyard (plaza) with restaurants. Excellent value for money. Next time we go to Berlin, we will certainly book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, some snags”
Reviews.Author: Jedburgh2
Reviews.Content: Excellent price via their website but a few snags (hence score of 2) which might not be so likely in a small family run hotel, and equally may not worry everyone. E.g. rooms are either overlooking the street or overlooking the quad; street has street noises 24x7, quad had late-night bar noises (till well after midnight while we were there). Hotel aircon is rarely reliable in my experience (ours was broken) which means closing the windows for peace and quiet may not be an option, and rooms on the quad don't get real "outside" air through the window anyway (the quad is fully enclosed). Beds ridiculously soft (but that seems to be a common problem). Couldn't get the in-house MyCloud WiFi working either, but an Internet station in reception worked fine. Also on the plus side, the quad has a daytime cafe and three restaurants; we enjoyed the cafe, the German, and the Italian restaurant but didn't try the Thai. The location while not central (hence the price?) is convenient for public transport. Summary: may not be the one for you if you enjoy your evening peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albaicin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, breakfast not included for 55 euro per night. The hotel is situated at the Frankfurter allee 73 a, within 200 meters of the U-bahn station (underground) Samaritaner, line 6 takes you straight to Berlin Alexanderplatz. From there you kan reach whatever you want in Berlin. A day pass (Tageskarte) for all public transportation within Berlin costs 6,00 euro and can be bought at any U-bahn station. The hotel room is quite spacious and ours was located at the backside of the hotel. This is a very fine location while from your room window you are looking into a plaza with a glass roof; On the plaza are several restaurants and shops. The plaza can be reached with the hotel elevator. Breakfast at the hotel costs around 15 euro per person. So if you are travelling on a budget it is cheaper to eat at the plaza where it will cost you maximum 5 euro p.p. The room was very tidy with a bathroom, TV, airco, refrigarator etc.. I would choose this hotel again on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: fatlamp
Reviews.Content: I booked through Accor's website and got a deal of 40EUR per night for 4 nights. That was even cheaper than Ibis and Etap. The hotel was in a office building complex, occupying one wing of the quad-shaped complex. The rooms were simple, clean and comfortable. The hotel is not centrally located, but transportation is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: FEnriqueCV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on November 16, 2005 for 3 nights and it was one of 5 hotel in a trip to Europe and it was the best! Receptionst very helpful, we had a early check in and they help us to keep our bagagge in a meeting room, rooms are quite large and very clean and bathrooms all clean, you can feel safe in there. The breakfast is plenty of all you can wish in the morning, hot meals, fruits, cereal, etc. Also, this hotel is into a place where you can find almost everything you need, ATM, restaurants, coffee, etc, even a good bar where you can hear live music singers and have a good time... I would really recommend this hotel as it is centrally located, close to a metro station Samaritansstrase and it is a very good deal, it worths a lot more than the price you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Berlin City Ost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcoRojo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel from 23 to 26 August. Excelent services, well sized room, with all you need. Very clean and excelent staff. The hotel is close to metro station (Samaritenstrasse). The hotel is placed into a small comercial centre with well restaurants, ATM's, supermarket, etc. Just in front you can find Restaurant La Palma, an excelent and very cheap italian restaurant. In my next visit to Berlin I will be in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel on the East Side”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I received this hotel as a result of a bid on Priceline ($50/night). I was very happy with the quality of this hotel for the bid I made. In fact, I was ecstatic. The hotel was wonderfully clean and located in an area that had everything you might need. Restaurants, bars, ATMs, etc.. The hotel is a five miunute walk from the Frankfurter Allee S- and U-Bahn station in a pretty section of the Friedrichshain area. The hotel is somewhat removed from all of the sights Berlin has to offer, but only a 15 minute subway ride away.

HotelInfo.Name: Arcadia Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Frankfurter Allee 73 a | Eingang Voigtstraße 2, 10247 Berlin, Germany (Formerly Tulip Inn)
